intro: Megalastrum canacae, commonly known as the Mexican starleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its star-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments in the understory of forests. Megalastrum canacae is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
